text:
Photos of a purported ‘beef party’ at the Central Hindi Institute here surfaced on social media, triggering protests by right-wing groups on Saturday and led authorities to launch an inquiry into the matter.

Institute officials said that prima facie no evidence was found of any such party on the campus though photos of the alleged beef party at the CHI hostel appeared online on Friday evening.

Senior police officials and Magistrate Rekha Chauhan also visited the CHI premises to inquire into the issue, which on Saturday led to a demonstration by a group of Bajrang Dal activists outside the CHI.

Meanwhile, CHI Registrar Chandra Kant Tripathi said that an initial inquiry had yielded no evidence of any such party on the campus. A CHI official added that non-vegetarian food is not served at their hostels.

Students from many countries study Hindi at the CHI, which is a premier institute under the Union HRD Ministry for promoting and popularising Hindi globally. — PTI
title: Online photos of ‘beef party’ at Agra institute spark protest
